intro: Lipozygis radula, commonly known as the red mangrove, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rhizophoraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive prop roots that extend into the water, providing structural support in tidal zones. The plant thrives in saline and brackish water environments, often found in mangrove ecosystems along coastlines. Its leaves are typically革质 (leathery) and have a waxy coating to reduce water loss.
